subject: Goodbye, 2007
event:
Another year about to end.  They seem to go past very fast of late. 

I had hoped to be able to finish A DANCE WITH DRAGONS during 2007.  Way back around this time last year, I had even hoped that the book might be published during 2007.  Neither of those happened, and to that extent the year was a disappointment... for me, as well as for my fans.

Other projects fared better.  THE ICE DRAGON, HUNTER'S RUN, DREAMSONGS, the SWORN SWORD comic book, the incredibly cool miniatures from Dark Sword, and soon to come the minibusts from Valyrian Resin and the replica of Longclaw from Valyrian Steel.  The rebirth of Wild Cards has been especially exciting.  INSIDE STRAIGHT will be out in less than a month, BUSTED FLUSH has been delivered, our new Wild Cards website is up and running, and the Wild Cards comic series and RPG are on the way (from DBPro and Green Ronin, respectively).  And then there are the two new anthology projects that I'm co-editing with Gardner Dozois, WARRIORS and SONGS OF THE DYING EARTH, both now well underway.  So it's certainly been a productive year.  In some ways an exhausting one.

Still, the new year looms.  I am not a big believer in New Year resolutions, but I do have some goals for 2008, both personal and professional, and the most urgent of those remains A DANCE WITH DRAGONS.  For more about DANCE, see the Update page of my website, which I intend to update in the next day or so.  See also the Samples page.  I've been alternating the first Tyrion chapter and the first Dany chapter there for the past year, but as a holiday gift to my readers, and a thanks for all their patience, I'm going to put up a new sample soon.

(It may take a few days to get the update and the sample up, be warned).

Here's hoping that 2008 is a year of triumph and wonderment for all of us.

comments.article: Thanks for the update.  A blessed new year to you.  Your loyal readers eagerly await news of Jon, Bran, Dany, Davos, and the rest.  We really appreciate the work you to do keep us posted.
comments.subject: Thanks

comments.article: Cryptic and intriguing. Looking forward to seeing what the update says!
Best of luck with the book and all of your other goals for the new year. :)
happy new year, george. good luck with everything.
Take your time Mr. Martin. Would much rather have a kick-ass ADWD that took awhile than something rushed out. The Dany and Tyrion chapters you've posted so far are pretty damn kick-ass though.

I wish you a wonderful New Year filled with every blessing.

:D

Ok Ok OK hmmmmmm he doesn't say it in this post just says: "For more about DANCE, see the Update page of my website, which I intend to update in the next day or so.", but the last sentence of the current update says:
"The next update will be the one that announces that the DANCE is done."
comments.subject: Hmmmmm

comments.article:
I suspect that a lot of people are excitedly reaching the same conclusion across the Internet :-)

I'd say be cautious. George may have decided to throw that out the window and instead give us a proper update on the book without it being finished yet.
comments.subject: Re: Hmmmmm

comments.article: Happy New Year!  I look forward to reading the new sample - and all of DANCE, whenever it's done.  I know it will be worth the wait.  :)

Happy New Year George (and indeed all GRRM fans). May you have a healthy and prosperous year in 2008.

Looking forward to the updates and offcourse ADWD! Now its off to start reading Dreamsongs!

comments.upictitle: Madam Lulzy the Great: Deedlit Relaxing
comments.article:
YOU CAN DO EET! YOU CAN DO IT ALLLL NIIIIGHT LONG!

I believe in you ;D Happy New Years George!

Don't stress over A DANCE WITH DRAGONS. I have always believed I would rather have a GOOD book than a fast book.

Keep up the good work.
A very Happy New Year to you and Parris!

Here's to wishing 2008 is a much better year. 2007 was a horrible year, for my family personally, although it was a slight improvement over 2006, in some ways anyway. For all of you that actually had a good year, well lets hope 2008 is an even better year.

Cheers,
Bill
comments.subject: Goodbye & Good Ridence

comments.article: You are an amazing writer and your work is worth waiting for!
Happy New Year to you, Mr. Martin. I hope 2008 is a much better year than 2007. And as for Dance, I'll wait as long as it takes. It's worth it. So are you.

comments.upictitle: in search of a clever byline: ETC - Vonnegut
comments.article: Happy New Year, George!

comments.upictitle: Madam Lulzy the Great: Deedlit Relaxing
comments.article: Your icon makes me smile way too much :D
Happy New Year Mr. Martin!!! =D

Wishing you happiness, good health and many good days of writing in this new year!

*hugs*

your icon made me make such a loud sad noise that my dad was all "what? what's wrong?"

is it stealable, with credit? because it sort of made my life right now.
Happy New Year, George! I look forward to your updates.

Happy New Year George. A Dance with dragons will be well worth the wait, even if it takes longer than expected. Better that, than QUICK and BAD.

I've heard a lot about your Dreamsongs collection, and intend on reading those eventually. I have read a couple of your other works, too. I liked Dying of the Light and Fevre Dream.

Well, maybe next year for the Jets. But at least the Giants made the playoffs.
comments.subject: Good Luck!

comments.article:
You're posting a sample???!

Yes! Best. Present. EVER!

Thanks so much Mr. Martin. You're the best. =D

comments.article:
Best wishes for a happy and prosperous new year.

Omedetoo Gozaimasu.

comments.upictitle: Soufflé Girl Wannabe: Saxon - Made of Win
comments.article:
Happy New Year, GRRM!

It's funny but I just finished rereading the entire series to date as of this week and am all twitchy for more. (It had been 10 yrs or more since I'd last read A Game of Thrones) I even was trolling fansites until 8 am this morning trying to find spoilers of chapters you've read/shared other than the 2 on your site which I've pretty much committed to memory.

Here's hoping we get Jon, Dany, Tyrion, Davos, et. al in the coming year. I know it'll be worth the wait! :)
Happy New Year, and best of luck with Dance! :)

This post just made me squee with joy. My fiance who is sitting next to me was like "you just spazzed out there all of a sudden". I can hardly wait for the sample!

This will be a happy new year indeed.
